name: peeper
content:
peeper noun [C]
(EYE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ usually plural ] informal a person's eye: She flashes her big dark peepers at me. He takes care to protect his peepers when on the court.

peeper noun [C]
(SECRET WATCHER)
someone who gets pleasure from secretly watching other people : Are you the peeper who looks in my windows? We are becoming obsessive peepers, loving to see other people's private lives. Synonym
voyeur

peeper noun [C]
(FROG)
(also spring peeper) a type of small North American frog, the males of which make a repeated high sound from around the beginning of spring: Sorensen detected peepers, grey tree frogs, green frogs, and American toads.
